samre_argument_history: Our argument is more detailed and transparent in its calculations. We break down the percentages of students who like only blue, only green, and both colors, leading to a clear understanding of how we arrive at the 19% who like neither. While our opponents use a formula, our step-by-step approach provides clarity and reinforces the logic behind the numbers, ensuring that all aspects of the survey data are accounted for accurately.

Our approach is more straightforward and efficient. We directly calculate P(either) using the formula P(either) = P(blue) + P(green) - P(both), which clearly accounts for overlap without unnecessary breakdowns. While our opponents' method arrives at the same conclusion, it complicates the process by separating the groups. Our method is concise and mathematically sound, leading to the same result of 19% for P(neither) without additional steps. This clarity strengthens our argument.
